; ;Zhou Tao   Picture/Liu Xin;

;

;;Whether it is in the oral autobiography "A Man and Xinjiang" or the novel "Journey to the West", Zhou Tao regarded himself as a specimen in that period of history. His unscrupulous self-exposure is due to his background in military life and his arrogant nature, just like his unbridled poetry and prose. At the same time, it also presents the true ecology of this special group of cadres' children in the long river of history. ;

;

;;;The beginning of chaos;;

;

;;Kashgar in early October , next to Ustang Boyi Road, a thousand-year-old street in Id Kah, musical instrument shops and carpet shops selling hot wapu and tambourines are lined up, and the craftsmen making copper pots are clanging and banging, surrounded by black The vat where the stove is brewing;;（;Sheep;);;The meat is sizzling. With the heat, the fragrance spreads far and wide. The tourists who flock here will definitely not let go of these antiques. They either raise their mobile phones to take pictures, or they want to eat two vats of meat, fresh and hot. ;

;

;;Forty-six years ago, Zhou Tao, a college student in Xinjiang, never imagined that a place he thought was a "purgatory" would now become a place of fascination and curiosity for inland tourists. ;

;

;;"When I heard that I was assigned here, my legs were weak. It's over, I collapsed.";

;

;;Before decentralization Although he had experienced the "baptism" of starving and carrying food on the Yili farm in the past 26 years, he always regarded himself as a son of cadres and his life was definitely going up. ;

;

;;This earth-yellow town completely buried his blueprint with its loneliness and indifference. ;

;
;

;;The crowded Uyghur residential areas are all built with adobe and wood... The houses are like beehives, the roads are like spider webs, and the civil buildings are all yellow. You clearly walked in, but there were very few people around, you couldn't hear anyone's voice, and the doors facing the street were all closed, as if you had walked into an empty and silent mountain forest alone. ;

;

;;It's like this every day. Ji Shuteng rides a bicycle from here to work at the prefectural committee and goes out under the city wall. From the gate of Daluo Dam, ride through the narrow dirt road on the side of the dam, pass through the road next to Abdul Kerim Street, then pass through the clanking streets of Ustangbuyi Street, and come to the cement-paved main street. On the spacious road, the car went straight down and arrived at the prefectural committee compound where he worked. ;

;

;;——"Journey to the West";

;
;

;;In the spring of 2018, 72-year-old Zhou Tao finally completed the autobiographical novel "Journey to the West" in his attic. He originally named it "The Beginning of Chaos" to refer to the confusion of young people during the "Cultural Revolution" who could not see the way forward. One day before the publication of "Contemporary", he suddenly realized that when he and his companions were sent to a remote place, they were on the way to the west: and "the west is the place where the sun sets, the place where snow accumulates, and the way to the west." It is a road with dusk clouds hanging low like a curtain, and people's hearts are always curled up in their chests. No one knows what void they will step on next. Maybe, if you are not careful, you will fall from the edge of the earth." ;

;

;;

;

;;In the book, he wrote about the career of Qu Ming, a "revolutionary scholar" who had ideals before and led the city later. Cheng Zhimin, the "perfect political loach", and decent Uyghur cadres like Simayi Ahematijiang have described the origins of power factions and the law of the jungle in Kashgar, a border area. ;

;

;;The main character in the book, Ji Shuteng, is handsome, has poetry and books in his belly, is arrogant, conforms to the customs at heart, is strong on the outside but is incapable of fighting the outside world politically. His ability, eyesight and life are all dependent on his wife. It is difficult for readers who know a little about the author to think: ;

;

;;Is this Zhou Tao himself? ;

;

;;Literary critic and editor-in-chief of "People's Liberation Army Literature and Art" Yin Shi saw the manuscript for the first time and was shocked. It was so direct! ;

;

;;“There was a lot of scar literature in the 1980s that exposed the problems of the era. Most of them were complaints from victims. When writing about a character or event, there seemed to be hidden dissatisfaction and slightness. The protest carries a very subtle criticism, but it is not clear and does not describe specific political life, political tasks, or political beliefs. When writing about the so-called villain, do not go deep into his heart. It's just a symbol.";

;

;;Yin Shi pointed out that in "Journey to the West", Qu Ming, who went to Yan'an to study Lu Yi as a teenager and received a red education, was in the "Cultural Revolution" During this period, he became a speculator and the strategist behind Cheng Qiang, hoping for the success of another "revolution" and a new distribution of interests. This was the main reason why Ji Shuteng gradually got rid of Qu Ming's influence. ;

;

;;Zhou Tao also wrote about the inner thoughts of Cheng Qiang, a "rebel" from a peasant background, his judgment of the political trends at the top, and his heroic and loyal to his inner beliefs. Method of suicide. ;

;

;;Ji Shuteng didn’t like Cheng Qiang, but when Cheng Qiang became a prisoner, he was not happy at all. Cheng Qiang almost committed suicide by jumping off a cliff, which made him even more upset. He was shocked. "He can't see others in trouble, just like he can't tolerate anyone being domineering... He loves freedom and advocates equality. Ji Shuteng also gradually sees another side of his nature. One person or some people bully or insult another person or some people, and This is not an ordinary thing, this is the kind of very horrific behavior; once this kind of thing begins, persecution, abuse, killing and destruction will follow.";

;

; ; During their eight years in Kashgar, Qu Ming and Cheng Qiang shaped Ji Shuteng in his conduct as a person, and he was eventually surpassed by him. However, Ji Shuteng did not escape the more terrifying mental terror and spiritual torture. ;

;

;;Ji Shuteng was reported because he expressed his inner thoughts about his leader in a casual chat. Ji Shuteng started to write a review, and he immediately felt like a deflated rubber ball. He wrote in the examination that he must be "reborn" and so on, but he didn't want to actually shed his skin like a snake. ;

;
;

;;"It doesn't hurt, it doesn't hurt at all, just feel free to peel it off, it'll be fine!" ”;

;

;;(wife) Zhuang Yan took off a piece and put it aside for him to see. He took off another large piece, "Oh, it's such a big piece!" He turned his face and saw that it was as big as half a tabloid. It was a piece of white paper with a tough texture. He said, "Don't throw it away. It's better to put it in the paper." It says inspection directly on it. Human skin inspection is more profound than what’s on the manuscript paper!”;

;

;;—— "Journey to the West";

;
;

;;In order to meet the distortion of history, people can even dehumanize themselves and cater to the atrocities of natural forces. Yin Shi believes that despite flaws in writing techniques and character creation, "Journey to the West" has the value of a "scientific investigation report on human nature" by unabashedly revealing the inner thoughts and showing the ups and downs and thoughts of cadres' children. "For a quasi-second-generation official like Zhou Tao, spiritual autobiography and documentary value are the first step, and self-examination is a further requirement.";

;

;;

;

;;If you combine "Journey to the West" with Zhou Tao's autobiographical oral record "A Man and Xinjiang" published a few years ago, you can better understand the extent of this "self-exposure". Among the latter, he spoke freely, peeling away the ridiculousness and patheticness of his father and family, as well as his own embarrassment, ugliness, and the dark side of human nature. ;

;

;;Such an individual is undoubtedly far removed from the traditional Chinese gentleman and Confucian scholar. It seemed that he was determined to tear off those masks that he had to keep and care about before he reached his seventies. ;

;

;;

;

;;The descendants of cadres in Xinjiang in the 1960s, the one from the right in the front row Zhou Tao;

;

;;;A deep sense of superiority;;

;

;;In After eight years in the ancient city of Kashgar, Zhou Tao finally had the opportunity to go to the Urumqi Military Region to engage in literary creation. After the troubled times, God gave him the most suitable arrangement for him who was both civil and military. ;

;

;;The rest of his life seems to prove that he has been on a smooth road since then. ;

;

;;Zhou Tao who left Kashgar, like Ji Shuteng in "Journey to the West", had no nostalgia for the yellow land where he had lived for a long time. ;

;

;;"Why are you so unsympathetic? The answer is: This is not my place in the first place." He believes that wherever a person grows up before the age of 18, that place will become His eternal home. ;

;

;;Before the age of 9, Zhou Tao lived in Beijing. Before receiving re-education in Yili and being transferred to Kashgar, he lived with his parents in Urumqi - clearly "higher" than southern Xinjiang in his eyes. ;

;

;;The sense of superiority is innate. The first is appearance. ;

;

;;He has been born with white skin and big eyes since he was a child. Among the dolls with foreign children, he is also the most eye-catching one. The whole Zhou family has fair skin. He once asked his aunt, what is grandpa like? My aunt said, "Your grandfather can't be compared to any of you. He's so handsome." Zhou Tao felt that his family's bloodline should be mixed, because his hometown in Yushe, Shanxi, is a mixed race area, "where the Xiongnu, Qiang, and Jiedi gather.";

;

;;Xiao Qiao, a military writer who is nearly 10 years younger than him, said that Zhou Tao was born with a "face and figure that make people doubt God's favoritism. Coupled with his humor, cunning, quick reactions and sharp words, This kind of person can easily make people jealous and at the same time create a desire for friendship." ;

;

;;Beyond the skin, family background is the foundation. ;

;

;;Zhou Tao’s father, Zhou Wenjie, participated in the Shanxi Anti-Japanese Youth Death Team in his early years;;（;The non-party groups at that time were actually anti-Japanese groups led by the Communist Party. They later became regular troops;);;, engaged in mass work, served as cultural teachers, and later became Chen Geng's subordinates. During the founding ceremony of the People's Republic of China, Zhou Wenjie, a battalion-level cadre, stood in the first row below the Tiananmen Gate. Later, he was admitted to the army as a diplomat and was assigned to the School of Foreign Languages. Before the "Cultural Revolution", he was a cadre at the fourteenth level. ;

;

;;Zhou Tao’s primary school classmates include many children of senior cadres. A sense of superiority was invisibly injected into Zhou Tao's mind during his childhood. He remembered that when his younger brother was born, the hospital made egg fried rice for his mother at noon. She refused to eat it and gave it to 4-year-old Zhou Tao. ;

;

;;At the age of 4, Zhou Tao was standing on a hillside in Haidian District, just in time for work in the morning. He felt like a general. "Looking at the gray, blue and black crowds of people under my feet, I suddenly felt a sense of superiority in my heart.";

;

;;Zhou Tao will remember this idea throughout his life. Strange: "How could such an idea come to mind at such a young age?";

;

;;That idea was the bud from the foundation of his thoughts throughout his life. The buds grow and are associated with him throughout his life. ;

;

;;His classmate Zhao Nan once saw a beggar on the street and said, what if we end up in this situation one day? Zhou Tao replied: "Even if we are reduced to this point, others will look different when we stand.";

;

;;"Many revolutionary children have that sense of superiority. In fact, compared to this Judging from decades of history, it is very superficial. The concept of 'the world' is also very decadent." Yin Shi said. ;

;

;;Zhou Tao was not aware of it. He wrote about the pride and stubbornness of Ji Shuteng's class in "Journey to the West":;

;
;

;; There is a little guy who is only in the third grade of elementary school and can memorize the names, positions, and military ranks of dozens of marshals, ten generals, and more than sixty generals. The man was surprised and asked: "Then what kind of general can you be when you grow up?" The answer was: "At least a general." When he grew up to sixteen or seventeen years old, he became more and more handsome, talented in sports and arts, just like the revolutionary career of his father's generation. There really is some kind of blood inheritance. But after entering society, most of them cannot adapt. ...As for the spiritual legacy of the Chinese revolution: the pursuit of social equality and the new culture of advocating altruism, they have completely disappeared. There is no doubt that Ji Shuteng himself is one of these people. He knows very well that he was "fed by strictly selected food." He is also convinced: "This is exactly how our generation is full of ambitions." Faith grows like a stone, water cannot be poured into it, needles cannot penetrate it, and it is difficult for anything else to penetrate into our minds.”;

;
;

; ;Among such a group of stubborn leaders with high vision, Zhou Tao's unruly attitude is even more prominent. ;

;

;;As evidenced by his father’s memories: “When Tao was fourteen or fifteen years old, he loved horseback riding and bicycle riding. Once, he went to Nanshan with a party school cadre and rode a Kazakh horse alone. The horse galloped on the mountain road, and the witnesses were horrified. The leader yelled and cursed before stopping.";

;

;;He has good physical fitness and once won the Xinjiang college men's table tennis singles championship. . But when I was in junior high school, I went to Beijing for a year of training, and I didn’t want to do it anymore. I deliberately trampled the ball and threw the racket on the wall. "I felt particularly awkward after the head coach asked me to change the crossboard, because my personality is offensive rather than defensive. If I was asked to play defense, I wouldn't want to. If I didn't want to, I would destroy it and quit.";

;

;;Although he is unrestrained and youthful, he also has a way of assessing the situation that is different from his peers. ;

;

;;At the age of fourteen or fifteen, he already understood that playing table tennis would not accomplish anything. It's not about physical condition or mind, it's about starting too late. "If I were to be in Beijing, I would definitely join the national team. The conditions are sufficient.";

;

;;There is another thing that he doesn't mind. Wu Guomei, a middle school Chinese teacher, gave Zhou Tao a score of 95 for his composition and gave him great encouragement. Other students regarded note-taking as a chore, but he was the only one who found joy in taking notes. "Why did I win as soon as I wrote prose? Because I had written it a long time ago, and the ten notebooks are prose.";

;

;;Literature is talent, and it is also Zhou Tao's upward path. The clearest one. ;

;

;;

;

;;In 1965, Zhou Tao won the Xinjiang college student table tennis singles championship< /span>;

;

;;;An Inhuman Year;;

;

;;《Twenty "Four Ploughshares" was often requested by Zhou Tao to be placed at the top of his collection of essays, which shows that he attached great importance to this article. ;

;

;;That came from the year he received re-education at Yili 9901 Farm. ;

;

;;When we went there, everyone sat in a big sedan and sang along the way, such as "Prairie Pastoral" and "Red Plum Blossoms on the Red Rocks". There was constant laughter and laughter, and everyone was full of joy. The feeling of starting a new life. ;

;

;;When I got there, I found that I had become a "prisoner" overnight: I was not allowed to leave the company for 25 meters, I had to report when I went out, and strict military management was implemented every day. "The grain puller saw it and said, 'How do you look like college students? What's the difference between you and labor reform prisoners? There are no distinctions between men and women, and all of them are in tatters. The horse pens are covered with straw, and rats are running overhead in the middle of the night, killing some people. My ear was bitten off." The arrogant and ruthless instructor refused to allow the sick students to see a doctor. Zhou Tao said that his biggest wish at that time was to "capture the instructor and throw him into the Gongnaisi River." ;

;
;

;;How far have we cultivated the grassland? (Gestures with hands) This is a yurt. The area around the yurt is all plowed, and the cultivated land is only five meters away from the yurt. "The white yurt has become an isolated island among the cultivated land.";

;

;;The yurt in the yurt The dog barked, and an old woman came out. Without saying a word, she looked at our tractor coldly, "That's not anger, that's contempt." That look condensed the coldness of more than seventy winters, and it made our souls look... broken into pieces.";

;

;;Now you see that my belly is big enough. At that time, my belly was like The huge hole dug by the excavator was completely sunken. I lost weight to 64 kilograms, and the bones on my face were all exposed. There are two bags of wheat weighing more than 80 kilograms. Two people hold the corners of the bag and lift it. You can dig it down and put it on your back. What did I do then? After I picked up the two bags by myself, I put them directly on my shoulders. I was so skinny but so strong (laughing). There are not many people who can do this. ;

;

;;There is a triangular roof on the granary. A steel bar needs to be driven down from the top, and screws are required on both sides. fixed. There was a bold man who was swinging a hammer from above, and I was supporting him from below. Once, he almost hit his head with the hammer. Another time I jumped out of the air and grabbed the rope. As a result, after I grabbed it, the rope was coiled and there was a long section of it that was not tied. If there was no tie at the other end, I would have to die, or I would be disabled if I didn't die. ;

;
;

;;At an age when hormones are overwhelming, I suddenly fell from the sky into a mud pit. He began to wonder about the relationship between origin and destiny. ;

;

;;"There is not much difference between people. Unless they are particularly stupid or particularly smart, most people are the same. The differences between people are caused by society. . I had a saying at that time - if we are equal, do you dare? If we are on the same starting line, who are we afraid of? But at that time, you were suppressed everywhere, hit walls everywhere, and nothing could be accomplished.";

;

;;This kind of thinking and playing will accompany you throughout your life. ;

;

;;

;

;;In the mid-1980s, three generations of Zhou Tao’s family took a group photo, front row The one holding the child on the left is Zhou Tao, the fourth from the left in the front row is Ma Wen, and besides the old man are Zhou Tao’s three younger brothers, his sister-in-law and their children;

;

;;;The father who "sits on the slide";;

;

;;Zhou Tao has always lamented that the 10 years between Yili and Kashgar were the most decadent years of his life. Looking back nearly fifty years later, he still laughs at his father's "confusion" and doesn't quite understand it. ;

;
;

;;In 1941 and 1942, my father got sick and became a patient in the garrison hospital. Japanese prisoners. He was hung up and tortured, but his identity as a soldier was never revealed. There was a traitor who came in first. He wrote a note to the traitor at that time, saying that you are also Chinese and we are all Chinese. My father meant for him to help. During the Cultural Revolution, he was labeled a traitor. ;

;

;;My father’s thinking style belongs to a small landowner family, and is a bit idealistic, far away from reality. It’s too far away, so I’m not very good at dealing with people, I’m enthusiastic about everyone, and I don’t adapt to Chinese culture. When Marvin came to our house and had a little contact, she said, "Why does your dad think like a foreigner?" ;

;

;;He is a very kind and honest person, but he is not a person with strong social ability. He has gone downhill in his life and is a slider. It's not that he doesn't want to follow, he wants to follow so much, but he can't. ;

;
;

;;In 1970, Zhou Wenjie, who had been expelled from the party, was sent to work as a farmer in the National Day Commune of Jimusar County, Changji. His mother also followed his father to the countryside. Two years later, the eldest son, Zhou Tao, completed his re-education at the Yili Farm and was assigned to Kashgar. He first took his wife to Jimsar to visit his family. His famous prose piece "Chronicles of Jimusar" was written about that experience. ;

;

;;

;

;;At the entrance of the village, Zhou Tao took a cigarette and took a break, planning to ask for directions later. An old man wearing a black cotton-padded jacket walked around him holding a dung basket. Zhou Tao wondered what he was looking at and still smiled. Take a closer look, isn't this my dad?  ;

;
;

;;The old man has completely become a rural old man. One is to dress in a rural style. One is the ruralization of his mental state, completely transforming him into a farmer. My mother stood waiting at the door. She looked very pitiful, her hair was gray and blown by the wind. My hair was not white when I went there, and I was already very old in my fifties. They feel that there is no possibility of coming back, and they will be like this for the rest of their lives. ;

;

;;......;

;

;;Looking at the man carrying the basket in front of me, I remembered that when I was a boy, I had a fierce fight with a group of urchins in the courtyard of the institution, dancing with guns and sticks, and suddenly appeared in front of the building angrily. He calls me a "mad dog"; he thinks of forcing me to help him wash the endless laundry of the whole family on Sunday. The water is biting and his hands are red from the cold, but he will not give up until he rinses away the last bit of soap suds; he also thinks of the man who used to wear a military officer's uniform. People who wore uniforms, then Chinese tunic suits, cadre uniforms, and finally put on peasant black cotton-padded jackets; and thought of my father who was once graceful, then solemn, and finally became old and confused and became what he is now. ;

;
;

;;In prose, he blamed himself for always underestimating his father because of his failures in reality, ignoring his essential qualities as a person. of excellent quality. ;

;

;;Paradoxically, from the way he speaks to the way he walks, from his body shape and facial features, to his habits and soul, no matter whether the social environment is favorable or unfavorable, he can never get rid of the influence his father injects into him. the genetics in one’s own body. ;

;

;;Later he realized that if his father did not suddenly appear, he would probably continue along the life trajectory of a Wuling prince, until one day he suddenly discovered I have been left far behind by the changes in society. ;

;

;;The temperament has also been restrained. "After his misfortune, I kept a low profile. I had a ghost and a weakness in my heart. I was much more honest and didn't dare to make it public anymore.";

;

;;In that era, literature was a hobby and a Find a way out for yourself and your family. Marriage is different. ;

;

;;My wife Ma Wen’s father was the political commissar and major general of the Southern Xinjiang Military Region at the time. In "A Man and Xinjiang", Zhou Tao admitted that his marriage was an obvious act of opportunism. For this reason, he abandoned his then lover and felt "feeling guilty for the rest of his life." ;

;

;;Ma Wen’s family originally did not agree to accept Zhou Tao, who was down and out at the time, but Ma Wen was devoted to being friendly with Zhou Tao and made it clear to his father, “It’s okay if you don’t let me be friendly with him. I listen to you, but I will never get married.";

;

;;Less than ten days after the wedding, Zhou Tao and Ma Wen went to Yili Farm together. Looking back, half a century has passed. ;

;

;;

;

;;Zhou Tao and his wife   Picture/Liu Xin;

;

;;The Marvin in front of me has fair skin and speaks clearly and forcefully. Five or six years ago, Marvin had eye surgery and his vision was almost zero. He usually wears sunglasses at home. Whether communicating with Zhou Tao or outsiders, he has his own aura. Zhou Tao injured his ear when he was shot when he was young. Now he needs to wear a hearing aid to talk to people. The backbone of the family can be seen at a glance. ;

;

;;Sitting in the bright courtyard of the Urumqi Army Community, Zhou Tao cherishes his wife's kindness. "She may have done it. She takes care of the inside and outside of the house. Don't look at her bad eyesight, she understands everything. She cut down all the trees in my yard and replaced them with crabapples and pomegranates. , dates, apricots, peaches, everything grows smoothly.";

;

;;Although Zhou Tao is crazy, he understands his shortcomings. He is outgoing and open-minded, but when encountering sudden setbacks, he easily becomes confused. The wife is not like that, she can always remain calm. "I know how to look at myself, not others. Marvin is good at recognizing people, good and bad. She can see clearly. Her ability to do things is outstanding among women.";

;

;; Marvin is also open to fame and fortune. Zhou Tao said that he had enough conditions to retire and move to Beijing, and the army could arrange a house for him. "Mrs. Ma didn't go. She said she was staying in Xinjiang. She is determined and not easily swayed by vanity.";

;

;;However, after the autobiography was published, a lot of people A female military writer couldn't hold back her anger and wrote an article criticizing Zhou Tao for giving up love and choosing the "most suitable" one;;（;the safest, The women who do not cause trouble;);; become partners, using the rhetoric of "Chinese men's traditional 'ugly wife and thin hot bed'", and finally summarizes and utilitarianizes the two women. Sexual judgment is tantamount to denying one's own guilt. ;

;

;;Zhou Tao did not respond at all. ;

;

;;"Have you shown the description in the autobiography to Teacher Marvin?" I asked him. ;

;

;;"No." Zhou Tao smiled. There was an understanding in the smile that "even if she saw it, she would just laugh it off", but also a trace of fear. ;

;

;;;No more poetry after the age of 40;;

;

;;In the late 1970s, fortune befell Zhou Tao, who had an unappreciated talent. Relying on his literary talent and his relationship with his father, he successfully transferred to the Military Region Creative Office in Urumqi and concentrated on making a living through literature. ;

;

;;When writers Cao Yu and Xu Chi went to Xinjiang in August 1978, after reading Zhou Tao's poem "North and South of Tianshan", they praised at a symposium that "it is sentimental and interesting. real poetry". Zhou Tao was caught off guard by this great news and thought of Liu Shaotang, the former "prodigy writer" who sparked his literary dream. "The teacher in high school was telling his story "The Green Mule" on the podium. He;;(Liu Shaotang)< /span>;;Sitting in class with classmates and listening to lectures. What a feeling that must be!" When I was 30 years old, I met an expert who appreciated me, and I felt happy in my heart. ;

;

;;The next two or three years became the explosive period of Zhou Tao's poetry. Xiao Qiao remembers that almost every two days in 1981, a new poem by Zhou Tao would gush out of magma from the ground. "Look at their dates, they are as dense as the footprints left by poets when they go out every day!";

;

;;Zhou Tao once collaborated with Yang Mu and Zhang Deyi to create "New Frontier Poetry", It is not about war, but about reflecting the unique features of the Xinjiang region. For a time, their names occupied the pages of "Poetry Magazine", "People's Literature", and "Shanghai Literature" one after another, and they were at the forefront of the literary trend. Liu Xiaowu, chairman of the Xinjiang Federation of Literary and Art Circles, objected to this on the grounds that "frontier poems were originally about conquering the northwest, but now Xinjiang is part of the motherland, who are you going to conquer?";

;

;;Wait After starting to write hazy poetry, Zhou Tao once gave himself a direction - "Guo Xiaochuan's voice, Wen Jie's color", but found that this combination "doesn't work very well". ;

;

;;

;

;;In 1984, three military writers were at Kunming Airport, preparing to take a flight The helicopter flew to Laoshan. From left to right are Li Binkui, Zhou Tao, and Li Yanqing;

;

;;In 1984, he and two other writers were ordered to create on the Laoshan front line. At first, he even told writers who had not gone up the mountain about the dangers of going up the mountain to scare them; later, he witnessed with his own eyes soldiers who were blinded by Vietnamese army mines. ;

;

;;After getting used to it, the soldiers can sleep well at night. "The helmets were lying beside the pillows, and their faces were sleeping like sculptures. They were all people who escaped from the hands of death.";

;

;;Tiantian and Soldiers They ate and slept together and became familiar with each other. Zhou Tao did not hear any heroic words from their mouths. ;

;

;;How does it feel to fight? The soldier said, "It's so scary when the enemy's shells are covering it. I wish I could crawl under the ground and climb up quickly, regardless of my posture. There's no way to express the terror. It's absolutely irresistible to human will. If you can escape, That's pretty good." Zhou Tao imagined that it would be the same when our artillery fire covered the other side. ;

;

;;He wrote a long poem of 2,000 lines, "Mountains, Mountains, Jungles." The poem not only contains the cruelty of war, but also a writing perspective that transcends victory, defeat and cause and effect: ;

;
;

;;My poor and stubborn neighbor;

;

;;My distant relative who has a melancholic temperament and is prone to disputes;

;

;;When I fight you;

;

;;My heart is actually angry and painful;

;

;;Almost crying while beating;

;

;;I beat another part of myself with tears ;

;

;;Dongfang——is the name of our common grandmother;

;

; " >;Generation after generation of dead did not make the earth rot;

;

;;but it was the living people who made it crowded and chaotic ;

;

;;All forms of death;

;

;;The purpose is to remind and explore the meaning of life;

;

;;The dead are no longer afraid of death;

;

;;The living are fearful;

;

;;——"Mountains, Mountains, Jungles, Jungles";

;
;

; ;This long poem has only been published in two not-so-famous frontier publications, and the single version has not been published due to the publishing company splitting the edition, so it has not entered the eyes of more readers. ;

;

;;"It's a bit of a pity. It has been ignored for no reason. If this poem can be published in full in a publication like "People's Literature", the impact will be great." Yin Shi et al. Many critics and friends expressed injustice for Zhou Tao. The author himself thought about it, "It was too easy to write, very casual. I just started writing it in the notebook for fun, and then it became longer and longer without changing a word. No one else believed it.";

;

;;Zhou Tao said that his only enemy is himself. ;

;

;;Writing poems was very exciting, but his requirement for himself was: my poems should reach the national level;;(top);;Level, I won’t write it down. Sure enough, when he won the National Award on his 40th birthday, he felt that his poetry career had come to an end. ;

;

;;The next hill to attack? Prose. ;

;

;;Zhou Tao believes that his contribution and originality lies in "liberation prose": "What is important in prose writing is not testing and dismemberment, but feeling and embracing". He does not like "research" ", preferring to indulge in endless daydreams, leisurely reflections, and tastes, so he doesn't care about the abruptness of the beginning, the transition and correspondence between the upper and lower paragraphs, and writes prose based on the logic, structure, and writing style of poetry. He even said arrogantly, "Prose has no rules. I am the rules.";

;

;;So in Zhou Tao's words, various memories, thoughts, emotions and imaginations rush together and cross paths. The river water on the embankment spreads in all directions on the endless grassland. ;

;

;;He is disgusted with the idea of ​​"traveling in mountains and rivers", thinking that it is just "treating mountains and waters as spiritual prostitutes." In the famous work "Gonnas's Horse", he regards the appreciation of the horse's spirit and muscles as an artistic enjoyment; in "Bird of Prey", he focuses on a horse that fought with an old wolf, its claws were dug into the bones of the old wolf and the trunk of the tree, and finally ran away. An eagle torn apart by wolves; in "Crossing the River", I marvel that a thin old Kazakh woman over eighty years old subdued a fierce horse that refused to cross the river...;

;

;;Whether it is a sacred mountain, a wild horse, or a human being, in Zhou Tao's passionate and bold expressions, there will always be a strong "master's self-statement" color, thinking that he is strong and sympathetic to the strong. ;

;

;;

;

;;His prose is characterized by its length;;(;Several articles are more than 20,000 words;);;, famous for his strong expression and impulse to think. Zhou Tao once had a calm understanding of this: "Speculation is a component in prose. If it is excessive, it will harm art. Therefore, I particularly value Jia Pingwa's prose. He does not focus on speculation but captures the hidden meaning of life. He pays more attention to the direct sensitivity to the original form of life. My recognition of him actually shows my recognition of some of my own shortcomings.";

;

;;Although it was over 20 years ago, Although he had the above understanding, his habit of eagerly expressing his thoughts has not changed since then. It can still be seen in "Journey to the West". ;

;

;;Zhou Tao has the complacency of a proud man and the fear of "losing what he has gained" hanging over his head. He is obsessed with literature, thinking that it is free, fair and unfair. As complex as politics is. 20 years ago, he won the Lu Xun Literature Award for the first time for his collection of essays, but he did not go to accept the award. ;

;

;;The reason? "The various literary awards are far from what I imagined. The awards must be fair. They must not be mixed up, and they must not be sprinkled with pepper. They must be awarded to those who are most worthy of the award. No matter who that person is, it may not be me." ;

;

;;He said that in the 1980s, the national goal was clear and everyone was full of hope. The entire era was the emotion exaggerated by "The Toast Song". But in the early 1990s, he inevitably developed a feeling of nihilism, drifted away from society, and was no longer so direct. "The Panic of Winter in Bortala" was written in such a state - but only a few people understand it. ;

;

;;

;

;;In March 1986, Zhou Tao (first from right) won the first place in the country The second New Poetry (Collection of Poetry) Award, the first from the left is the famous poet Ai Qing, and the award recipient is Hu Qiaomu;

;

;;;Destined? ;;

;

;;In "Journey to the West", which was completed more than 20 years later, Zhou Tao wrote that Ji Shuteng and other cadres went to the countryside and enjoyed a meal of grilled fish under the Populus euphratica forest by the Yarkant River. Feast: "The ancient Maigaiti people used magic to catch big and lively fish from the river! ... The tray was presented, and the taste was really fragrant!";

; < p>;;What is worth noting is not the delicious food, but the attitude of the food provider and the user: ;

;
;

;;The leaders of the inspection team sat cross-legged in the open space among the Populus euphratica trees, and the floor was covered with gorgeous Hotan carpets. The villagers held the trays, bowed their heads, and crouched like they were serving an emperor. Who taught them these great rituals? When did this tearful civilization develop? Ji Shuteng suddenly felt guilty, feeling that he was not worthy of such a feast and pious etiquette, and felt sorry for these desert people who danced the sword dance beside the campfire and painted peasant paintings in the orchard. What have we done for others to deserve such grand reception? ”  ;

;

;;——"Journey to the West";

;
;

;;This reminds me of Zhou Tao's long essay "Essays on Halashal" written in the 1980s. In that article, he associated the chapped lips of his fellow travelers with Ma Zhongying's Hui people more than half a century ago. The soldiers fought bloody battles with the Uyghurs of Hoja Niyazi, but now, the relics of the past are left by the thirsty lips of the north.; ">;Waterless ravines;);;ate up all.;

;

;;He saw in the Hui people living in Yanqi A kind of "hundred years of loneliness" that not everyone can feel: ;

;
;

;;Forbearance and silence Behind the eyes of suspicion and sly distrust is the most sincere promise and life-saving friendship; the pain caused by the contradiction between the humiliating inferiority complex and the strong self-esteem deep in the heart; not being understood But they stubbornly want to preserve the barriers they have formed; the sadness and stubbornness caused by the great contrast between the backward lifestyle of remoteness and poverty and the self-confidence of the sky are the result of this kind of hundred years of loneliness.;

;
;

;;He pointed out, "The history of the Chinese nation is not just the history of the Han people. There are countless emperors, famous ministers, and military generals who have served the country in the past generations who are from ethnic minorities. . " ;

;

;;Such ink and views are rare in his decades of rich writing.;

;

;< span>;Yin Shi, who has been friends with him for many years, sharply pointed out his problem: "He still doesn't express enough about the land of Xinjiang and the Uyghurs and other ethnic minorities. Zhou Tao also expressed the shrewdness of a Han man on this point. He did not learn from the language, classics, secular culture, or any other aspect - he did not go deep into Xinjiang. ";

;

;;In the analysis of "Journey to the West" just written, Yin Shi said bluntly: "If each of them;;(protagonist); ;'s inner world can also be unfolded like Ji Shuteng's, especially if the personal spiritual world, cultural character and even national attributes of the Uyghur character Simayi Ahematijiang are deeply explored and presented. Then the many voices in this work, including the dialogue between different 'voices', will create great tension. ";

;

;;Why can't it be expanded?;

;

;;"The language barrier is one, and the fear of being real is the other. It can only go so far. "Zhou Tao answered me.;

;

;;He has expressed his admiration for Zhang Chengzhi, but he also admitted that the latter has reached the extreme in his faith. In fact, Zhou Tao's major in university is Uyghur, but within half a year, the road to higher education was cut off by Yili's "re-education".;

;

;;The angle from which he expressed his regrets and lamentations was: "If I have completed four years of study, When I learn the Uyghur language, I can work as a secretary in a commune in southern Xinjiang, and then as a county-level cadre. I will learn more about ethnic relations and human affairs, and then go into historical research and ethnic investigation, and I will be able to organize a full-length novel. But I didn’t have much interest in learning Uyghur during that half year, and I couldn’t see it that far. ”;

;

;;He is psychologically very close to grassland peoples like Kazakhs, and compares himself to “a semi-nomad who is used to yurts and mutton, and loves grasslands and riding horses.” As for Xinjiang, where he grew up, he considered this place his hometown, but he always observed and experienced it based on the roots of the Central Plains culture.;

;

;;In the literary critic Wei Qi In Hong's view, Zhou Tao rarely describes life in the market, nor does he take it as his duty to express the joys, sorrows, joys, and aesthetic tastes of the people. Instead, he tries his best to publicize his own personal life experience. Therefore, his writing also presents a kind of "aristocratic" style. tendency.;

;

;;

;

;;Looking back on most of his life, Zhou Tao said that he was somewhere between civil and military: Born in the army, it was martial; Background: studying literature and going to school; becoming an athlete and joining martial arts; coming back to school and liking literature and then following literature: after studying literature, he eventually went to the barracks to study literature. They are all nourishing you, and they are all restricting you; restriction is also nourishment. ";

;

;;When he was old, he was considered to be the highest-ranking civilian cadre in the army and enjoyed military-level treatment. On the contrary, his mother, who had been caring for him all his life, heard his son Tao say, "Mom, I'm going to be a general." He replied, "You haven't fought a day in a battle, how can you be a general? ";

;

;;"What have the eight years in Kashgar taught you? "I asked him.;

;

;;He replied: "It's not what you are born with. Your personal conditions must be displayed and expressed under the general trend of a society. Otherwise it's worthless. ";

;

;;"Are you a fatalist? ";

;

;;He nodded. "Everyone has his own destiny, and destiny is the possibility given to you by society. Those who are courageous but not ignorant are "two poles", and those who are knowledgeable but not courageous are nerds. Only with courage and luck can you achieve great things. Me and Marvin? It's not luck, it's fate. ”;

;

;;In an era when the whole family was torn apart by political movements, he questioned: “From being a free boy born in a family, to becoming a person who is influenced by society and his own conditions. Adults embedded in a certain profession, fate, how will you send us? Do you show special favor to us or are you particularly indifferent? Regarding the latter possibility, we were unwilling to consider and could not accept it at that time. ”;

;

;;Fifty years have passed, and the answer to the mystery has been completely revealed. What surprised him infinitely was that the answer to today’s mystery had been revealed to him one after another. He always believed that that By that time, everything is doomed.;

;

;

;The new drama "Tian Geng Ji" has ended. The rating is not high, but the popularity is not low.

;

;It is adapted from the farming novel "The Rebirth of a Little Landlord": a modern girl, Lian Maner, wanders into the ancient countryside and becomes a peasant girl. Together with the mysterious man Shen Nuo, she battles wits and courage with her best relatives to seek justice for her cowardly "parents". Under limited conditions, he worked hard to get rich and worked hard. He gained not only his farming career but also his love.

;

;The secret behind the popularity of "Tian Geng Ji" is just two words - farming.

;

;;;

;Among the online articles that emphasize fast pace and strong narrative, farming articles that focus on stable happiness appear to be somewhat unique. The development of farming literature is divided into three stages.

;

;Born out of SLG (strategy) games in the early days, the protagonist, like the player, recruits troops and horses in a different world, completes tasks, and develops the economy or agriculture with the purpose of "building walls high, accumulating food widely, and becoming king slowly" , and continue to expand its own power.

;

;The middle period focuses on the literal meaning, allowing the protagonist to make a fortune in feudal society, and the narrative style becomes warm and peaceful. In addition to "Rebirth of a Little Landlord", the original work of "Tian Geng Ji", popular novels such as "Daily Life of Farming and Raising Children in Ancient Mountain Houses" and "I Sell Hotpot in the Song Dynasty" also belong to the category of farming literature in this period. ;

;

;;The style of farming literature and painting in the later period is clear; Strange. It integrates infinite flow, fantasy, suspense and other factors based on the basic thinking of "farming" to achieve the fusion of genres. For example, "After rebirth as the Dragon King, I make a fortune from seafood", "I rely on farming to save mankind in the interstellar world" and so on.

;

;If we want to find ; a source for farming literature in traditional literature, then the closest source is local literature. Both of them focus on the rural landscape, but the background of rural literature is thick and usually carries narratives of suffering, while farming literature is written in a light and soothing vacuum. ;

;

;;

;

;;The road to film and television adaptation of Zhongtian novels has been relatively bumpy. Compared with other web novels with strong conflicts and many reversals, it is actually; not that suitable for being adapted. onto the screen. What are now being adapted into "farming dramas" are generally medium-term farming dramas that are slow and steady, and are less difficult to shoot than early farming dramas and later farming dramas.

;

;"Chef Fang Holding a Pot in the Flower Room" and ";The Sparkling Chef in the World" are relatively successful examples. There are no grudges or resentments, and they only revolve around women pursuing careers. The protagonist unfolds a small incision narrative. Both dramas weakened the farming attributes, amplified the food elements, and used delicious dishes to evoke the audience's empathetic experience. ;

;

;;

;

;;The annual hit drama "Do you know whether it should be green, fat, red and thin" is adapted from the farming novel of the same name, which tells the story of Sheng Minglan, the concubine of the Sheng family, who uses her intelligence and talent to succeed in the big family. A story of surviving and overcoming the many challenges of life. The drama version deletes the time-travel elements in the original work, making the heroine's logic of acting according to the rules in a feudal society with strict hierarchies and distinctions between descendants and concubines more consistent. ;

;

;;"Do You Know" while weakening the farming elements, highlights the family fighting and business elements, and enhances the dramatic conflicts. There was a discussion around the concubines of Da Niangzi, Lin Xiaoniang and Mo Lan. More than the heroine Sheng Minglan. ;

;

;;

;

;;"Jade Face and Peach Blossom Always Encounter" is adapted from "The Butcher's Little Lady". It takes Hu Jiao's growth from assisting her husband to taking charge of her own role as the main line. It highlights the power of women in concept and presents the above story. But he was short of breath. ;

;

;;

;

;;To sum up, although "Tian Geng Ji" is not; the first farming drama, it is undoubtedly the most relevant, showing the simplicity and leisure of farm life. , and depicts the discord among clan relatives.

;

;The heroine Lian Maner’s career line (complete system tasks and earn 1,000 gold), love line (she and Shen Nuo change from firm allies to intimate lovers), and love line (help parents to be wise) Fighting with Wude relatives) with three hands, striving to be the winner of every track. ;

;

;;

;

;;But judging from the feedback from the audience: the love line is too boring and lacks a sense of CP, the family line is too annoying and affects the audience's emotions, and what everyone loves most is the farming career line. ;

;

;;After all, love stories are rampant in contemporary online dramas. If you click on any idol drama, you can get handsome men and beautiful women falling in love in any era and any industry; it is so annoying. Relatives who will not pay for their lives have also watched a lot of costume dramas and urban dramas in recent years, so it is inevitable that they feel the same. ;

;

;;Therefore, it is not difficult to understand that "Tian Geng Ji" was ultimately popular for the seemingly insipid farming line, rather than anything else. ;

;

;;It can't help but be reminiscent of "Farming", a phenomenal variety show in the first half of this year. 10 young guests spent 190 days on 142 acres of land. of sowing and harvesting. Maybe even they themselves didn't expect that there would be so many viewers willing to watch them farming. ;

;

;;

;

;The nostalgia for farming is engraved in the DNA of the Chinese people. Ten years ago, the virtual vegetable growing game QQ Farm became very popular. Some people stayed up late at night and drove to see the sea. Some people got up early and went to bed early just to set the alarm clock and steal vegetables. Ten years later, people moved to WeChat farms, raising chickens, fish and pigeons in the status bar. Turn on your mobile phone, and all major e-commerce platforms have launched virtual services such as watering trees, planting trees, and operating orchards, and linked them to real benefits.

;

;For Chinese people, "farming talent" is an initial skill that can be obtained without ; lighting it up. For thousands of years, Chinese society has been dominated by agricultural civilization, which has condensed the wisdom of the working people and given birth to a broad and profound Chinese culture. ;

;

;;Tao Yuanming's poem "Picking chrysanthemums under the eastern fence, leisurely seeing the Nanshan Mountain" also symbolizes the Chinese people's pursuit and yearning for pastoral life. New. ;

;

;;Contemporary young people read Tao Yuanming and also pursue farming essays and farming dramas (comprehensive). If the utopian imagination constructed by the former is distant and ethereal, and somewhat unreal through the silk curtain of the times, then the comfort provided by the latter is within reach and approachable. ;

;

;;

;

;;In the era of rapid development, everything; is rushing forward like clockwork. Young people are rushing forward in the rapid current, but occasionally they also think about it. Take a breather after dinner and look for an emotional outlet. Therefore, slow-paced and beautiful farming dramas are an excellent way to relieve stress. And compared with radical entrepreneurial stories, farming also has a certain sense of security. Every time you work, you will gain, and the effort and reward are generally proportional.

;

;In the 1960s, Taiwanese health realism films had a binary opposition of urban or rural narratives, with implicit praise and blame in the beautiful rural scenery.

;

;Today, sixty years later, the "farming flow" actually also hides a certain creative tendency. The countryside is often a healing utopia, while the city is a heterotopia that confused young people want to escape from. . Through a small screen, urbanites can also become farmers remotely.

;

;Although the farming literature and farming dramas have shortcomings such as outdated narratives, stereotyped characters, and a slightly dull rhythm, they accurately hit a spreading and popular public sentiment. We might as well give them more room for growth, and I believe there will be more hits.

;As one of the most sought-after items in the fashion circle, the popularity of sneakers is receding.

;

;On September 22, Guirenniao issued an announcement stating that in view of the decline in revenue and continued losses of the sports shoes and apparel business since the judicial reorganization, and the increasingly fierce market competition, the company will end the sports shoes and apparel business that has been in business for 36 years. And the grain business will be the company's main business development direction in the future.

;

;Guirenniao’s financial report shows that from January to June 2023, Guirenniao’s sports shoes and apparel business achieved operating income of 232 million yuan, a year-on-year decrease of 19.51%. From 2018 to 2022, ST Guiren’s annual net profit attributable to the parent company suffered 4 losses, with a cumulative loss of more than 2 billion yuan. The number of "Guirenniao" brand retail terminals has dropped from 2,358 in 2019 to 1,584 in the first half of 2023.

;

;;;

;At the same time, Anta Sports, Li Ning, and Xtep International have successively released their financial reports for the first half of 2023. Facing the recovery in performance of Nike and Adidas in China, domestic products are still struggling.

;

;However, compared with last year’s report card where Anta’s revenue surpassed Nike China’s and Li-Ning’s revenue was ahead of Adidas China’s, there is still a certain decline in performance.

;

;;;

;Data show that in the first half of this year, among the three major domestic sports brands, only Xtep is still significantly expanding its stores. The current total number of stores is 8,256, ranking second. Li Ning has a net decrease of 155 main brand stores and is the only group that has no net increase in brand stores.

;

;;;

;In the past, due to the brand effect of several major fashion brands, Adidas and Nike had absolute advantages over domestic Anta, Li Ning, Xtep, and 361 Degrees.

;

;;;

;Today, the three giants of domestic products are deeply involved in their own core technologies - Anta's "nitrogen technology", "Li Ning's" flick technology, and Xtep's "XTEP ACE cushioning technology platform". They have fully blossomed with differentiated strategies. Anta and Li Ning have continued to Leading the domestic sports brand market for two years.

;

;;;

;In the future, if sports brands want to go further, they cannot just "rest on their laurels" or "rest on their laurels". The addition of design languages ​​such as accessories, graffiti, and deconstructive splicing in shoe design has been squeezed out of the mainstream. The scope of the discussion was replaced by the proposition of "how to make sneakers not like a pair of sneakers."

;

;;;

;De-sneakerization and artificial intelligence are innovative paths worth exploring. At the same time, guided by audience thinking, sports brands must better understand the hearts of young people.

;

;;

;

;With the rise of DIY culture, more and more young people are creating secondary creations on sports shoes, transforming old shoes through graffiti, modification, and homemade methods. With the emergence of the national trend, the sales of Huai Li Guochao modified shoes have increased rapidly and are loved by many young people.

;

;Today, "Know" will discuss with you how domestic sports shoes can break through the bottleneck.
